SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.ckd

Interface Issues

All Superinterfaces:
org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlTokenSource
All Known Implementing Classes:
IssuesImpl
public interface Issues extends org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlObject
CKD clinical issues configuration interface. Defines the contract for managing clinical issues within the Chronic Kidney Disease clinical decision support system. This interface provides comprehensive array manipulation capabilities for clinical issue identifiers that are relevant to CKD patient care. Clinical issues in this context represent structured medical conditions, diagnoses, or clinical problems that: - Indicate increased risk for kidney disease development - Suggest need for CKD screening or monitoring - Influence CKD treatment decisions or protocols - Represent complications or comorbidities of existing CKD The interface extends XMLBeans XmlObject to provide comprehensive XML serialization and deserialization capabilities for integration with EMR configuration systems.
Since:
2010-01-01

      static final org.apache.xmlbeans.SchemaType type

  • Method Details

    • getIssueArray

      String[] getIssueArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of clinical issue identifiers.
      Returns:
      String[] array containing all configured clinical issue identifiers relevant to CKD management, may be empty but never null

    • getIssueArray

      String getIssueArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific clinical issue identifier by array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the clinical issue to retrieve
      Returns:
      String the clinical issue identifier at the specified index
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xgetIssueArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] xgetIssueArray()
      Retrieves the complete array of clinical issues as XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method provides access to the underlying XMLBeans representation, preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities for clinical issue identifiers.
      Returns:
      XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects containing clinical issues

    • xgetIssueArray

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString xgetIssueArray(int index)
      Retrieves a specific clinical issue as an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the clinical issue
      Returns:
      XmlString XMLBeans object preserving type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • sizeOfIssueArray

      int sizeOfIssueArray()
      Returns the total number of configured clinical issues.
      Returns:
      int count of clinical issue identifiers in the array (0 or greater)

    • setIssueArray

      void setIssueArray(String[] issues)
      Replaces the entire clinical issues array with new values. This method overwrites all existing clinical issue configurations with the provided array. Use with caution as it will remove any previously configured clinical issues for CKD management.
      Parameters:
      issues - String[] new array of clinical issue identifiers to set

    • setIssueArray

      void setIssueArray(int index, String issue)
      Updates a specific clinical issue identifier at the given array index.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the clinical issue to update
      issue - String new clinical issue identifier value
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • xsetIssueArray

      void xsetIssueArray(org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString[] issues)
      Replaces the entire clinical issues array using XMLBeans XmlString objects. This method allows setting clinical issue identifiers while preserving XML schema type information and validation capabilities.
      Parameters:
      issues - XmlString[] array of XMLBeans string objects

    • xsetIssueArray

      void xsetIssueArray(int index, org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString issue)
      Updates a specific clinical issue using an XMLBeans XmlString object.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the clinical issue to update
      issue - XmlString XMLBeans object with type and validation information
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid

    • insertIssue

      void insertIssue(int index, String issue)
      Inserts a new clinical issue identifier at the specified array position. All existing clinical issues at and after the specified index will be shifted one position to the right. The array size will increase by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      issue - String clinical issue identifier to insert

    • addIssue

      void addIssue(String issue)
      Appends a new clinical issue identifier to the end of the array. This is the most common method for adding new clinical issues to the CKD configuration. The new issue will be added at the end of the existing array.
      Parameters:
      issue - String clinical issue identifier to add

    • insertNewIssue

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString insertNewIssue(int index)
      Inserts a new empty XMLBeans XmlString clinical issue at the specified position. Creates and inserts a new XMLBeans XmlString object that can be populated with clinical issue data while preserving XML schema validation.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based insertion position
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • addNewIssue

      org.apache.xmlbeans.XmlString addNewIssue()
      Appends a new empty XMLBeans XmlString clinical issue to the array. Creates and adds a new XMLBeans XmlString object at the end of the array that can be populated with clinical issue data.
      Returns:
      XmlString newly created XMLBeans object for population

    • removeIssue

      void removeIssue(int index)
      Removes a clinical issue identifier at the specified array index. All clinical issues after the removed element will be shifted one position to the left. The array size will decrease by one.
      Parameters:
      index - int zero-based index of the clinical issue to remove
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is invalid
